snippet: In Alexander Harrington’s new drama, “The Great Society,” the complex and conflicted Lyndon B. Johnson comes across as the biggest Vietnam-era pacifist in the White House.
abstract: Daniel M Gold reviews York Shakespeare Company production of Alexander Harrington play The Great Society at Clurman Theater; Seth Duerr directs and Mitch Tebo stars.
lead_paragraph: In Alexander Harrington’s new drama, “The Great Society,” the complex and conflicted Lyndon B. Johnson comes across as the biggest Vietnam-era pacifist in the White House.

headline.seo: In ‘The Great Society,’ a Conflicted Lyndon B. Johnson
headline.main: A White House Warrior on Poverty, Vietnam and Race
headline.print_headline: A White House Warrior on Poverty, Vietnam and Race
